text: Bottled. A yellow sake. The aroma has notes of rice, alcohol, cedar, and a bit of lemon. The flavor is sweet with notes of rice, cedar, alcohol, , and a bit of lemon, leading to a dry alcoholic finish.
300, screwtop. Booze, lemon, and green apple nose. Hazy pour, near transparent. Light airy body; booze, green apple, and lemon on the mid palate. Mild finish.

Bottle. Poured clear straw color with fair legs. Moderate vanilla and melons aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and good legs. Medium fruit and rice flavor with a medium dry and warming finish of moderate duration. My expectations were met.
Sweet candy fruit aroma. Light bodied sweet beginning with a bitter middle and spicy finish. Palate gets creamier in the end.
Not a very pleasant daiginjo. Aromas of cardboard, fungi and somewhat old. Still inside the best before date, this was not the cause.

On way to The Jeffrey stopped for a little sushi and grabbed this. Pours clear with light nose of melon. Tastes of honey dew, peaches, vanilla, pineapple, and fresh cut wood. Thin bodied and not quite as smooth as good daiginjo.
Flaska från @thaalcoholic. Tack! Fermenterat ris och fruktighet. Lite mer alkohol i smaken än vanligt

Pours yellowish. Could have nicer legs. The nose is fruity and has ripe banana, cotton candy, and faint anise notes, but it is nothing too complex. On the palate, it displays its semi-dry character and medium body while the flavors follow the nose. The finish has a brash alcoholic taste and is a bit too bitter. The bouquet was the most pleasing part; decent overall if drunk chilled.
The first more unpleasant Sake so far. Bit too bitter in the end. Pepper aromas and some peaches. Gets better after a while. Average one.

Pours out in a clear light vanilla colour with medium body. Nose of aromatic rice and peaches. Taste of berries, peaches, vanilla, grass and melon. Strong hints of rice. Finishes quite dry and little bit unpleasant....dull, too much alcohol, boring. Stronger than other Sakes around. Solid one.
